clues.text: The most honored show in Tony history is this 2001 Mel Brooks musical that won in 12 categories
This musical's original Broadway cast featured Barry Bostwick as Danny Zuko & Adrienne Barbeau as Betty Rizzo
Musical numbers in this 2003 show include "Dear Old Shiz" & "The Wizard and I"
Extra! Extra! This musical is based on a real 1899 strike by paperboys against the New York World
This 2012 musical with a one-word title is set in Dublin, where a street musician falls in love with a Czech immigrant
Roger Sterling, Miss Blankenship, Sally Draper
Dr. Cristina Yang, Dr. Miranda Bailey, Dr. Derek Shepherd
Max (a woman), Caroline, Oleg the cook
Thomas Boleyn, Edward Seymour, Anne Parr
Meyer Lansky, Senator Warren G. Harding, Chalky White

When Grandma's looking for these, sometimes they're on top of her head:
SAG LESS

If the lumbago comes back, Grandma's grateful for this program:
ICE DREAM

Grandma had a mania for this singer in the '60s:
MY NUCLEAR PACT

Hoping to meet her friend Juan from college, Grandma's taking a cruise to this city:
CANAL ROBE

Once a Democrat, & once a Republican, Grandma leans this way now:
RETAIL BRAIN
Like our "Indian" one, a spell of warm, pleasant weather in October in Greece is called this "of St. Dimitrios"
It can be a dry spell in the weather or, for a batter, going a long time without a hit
A 10 on the modern Beaufort scale for this means ocean waves will have dense white streaks
Also a cloud surrounding a deity, it's the type of cloud that brings rain
T.S. Eliot wrote, "under the brown" one of these "of a winter dawn, a crowd flowed over London Bridge"

1991: "Ice by Ice"
2012: "Luck or Something Like It" by a singing "gambler"
2009: "Miles to Go" by a teenager
2012: "Who I Am: A Memoir" by a British guitarist
Part of the sole family, a hogchoker is a North American variety of this creature
The object called this is upright, but the person called this is not; he's a seller of stolen goods
According to the OED, in 1772 this word meaning "new word" was a new word
It can mean soft or delicate or, on U.S. currency, money offered for payment of a debt
10-letter word for an indoor swimming pool--nice vocabulary there, Caesar
"You are now free to move about the country" on this airline
In about 2,000 years, Gamma Cephei will replace Polaris as this
Rikers Island is in this navigable tidal strait; the RFK Bridge spans it
Horace Greeley is generally credited with this 4-word phrase, but some say John Soule used it earlier
This annual event began in 1987 to showcase the Austin music scene to industry pros
In per-store gross, White Castle was #1 in 1984 fast food business, edging out this huge competitor
One version says the name of this product was inspired by a picture of William Penn
This Texas department store's 1965 catalogue had a page "How to Spend $1 Million" there
Cincinnati-based company that makes largest selling toothpaste, detergent, & dandruff shampoo in U.S.
Big holes were 1st put in '45s to force buyers to use players "initially" made only by this company
The L.A. Times called this the "sport of kings, queens & pawns"
Guinness says Con McCarrick once played 154 games of this, also called draughts, simultaneously
Shape of the windowed piece that players - or spirits - move around the Ouija board
Mia Farrow used the letters in this game to decipher a witchy anagram in "Rosemary's Baby"
In backgammon, each player starts out with this number of men on the board
A shelter for dogs, it's from the Latin "canis" meaning "dog"
A hard or chewy candy made of brown sugar & butter
On July 25, 1986, Los Angeles saw it at 7:59 p.m. PDT
In Matthew, chapters 5-7, Jesus delivered one "on the mount"
This lighter-than-air element only rose to #2 on the periodic chart
She convinced a judge to cut 10 years off her legal age - perhaps by saying "coochi-coochi"
As a Future Farmer of America he raised blue-ribbon hogs, but his Farm Aid raised funds for farmers
Billed as "The Other Sheena", this singer's ex-husband impersonates her in nightclubs

Maybe "Monkee" business kept him away: he only joined the other Monkees once on their '86 tour
Experts say to avoid wrinkles around the eyes, stop smoking & wear a pair of these outside during day

Of 6%, 21%, or 53%, percentage of U.S. mail comprised of personal letters
While she is judged in one, Miss America is forbidden to wear one in public after winning

rounds.text: The desire in his childhood to catch every insect inspired Satoshi Tajiri to create this 1996 game
